themes: Need for stable and transparent funding processes
Importance of listening to experienced staff and the creative community
Lack of sustainable physical spaces for cultural activity
Insufficient private sector and philanthropic support
City's role in leveraging influence for cultural funding
key_phrases: Less rapid and unpredictable change of funding programs
listening to more of the creative community
trusting the experienced staff in CAD
Sustainable and reliable funding for physical long term spaces
ACA speaks on behalf of people it doesn't represent
city of austin to use its reputation and leverage
different source of funding outside of HOT tax
lack of cohesive and trusted advocacy org
barriers_identified: Rapid and unpredictable change of funding programs
ACA misrepresenting the community and holding undue influence
Lack of sustainable funding for physical spaces
Insufficient private sector and philanthropic involvement
Lack of a cohesive and trusted advocacy organization
solutions_proposed: Stabilize and make funding programs more predictable
Listen to a broader segment of the creative community
Trust and utilize experienced staff in CAD
Provide sustainable funding for independent, long-term cultural spaces
Develop a better local arts advocacy organization
City should leverage its influence to engage private industry in cultural funding
Seek funding sources beyond HOT tax
